Class MainController

  • java.lang.Object
    • MainController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TriggerHandler

    public class MainController
extends java.lang.Object
implements TriggerHandler
    The MainController is responsible for connecting all components of the automation framework. The main controller contains a list of all of the Service objects in the system, a list of all of the Peripheral objects in the system, a NetworkAdapter that handles communication to peripherals, and a list of all of the TriggerLogicBlock objects in the system, which gives access to every logic block in the system. The main controller also starts the HTTPS server that handles user information requests and handles all database communication for the system.
    Author:
    Shawn Koop

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String databasePassword
      A String containing the database password.
      private java.lang.String databaseURL
      A String containing the URL of the database.
      private java.lang.String databaseUser
      A String containing the database user name.
      private NetworkAdapter mAdapter
      A NetworkAdapter that handles all communication with physical peripherals.
      private java.util.ArrayList<Peripheral> peripherals
      An ArrayList containing all of the Peripheral objects in the automation system.
      private java.util.ArrayList<Service> services
      An ArrayList containing all of the Service objects in the automation system.
      private java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<TriggerRequest> triggerQueue
      A LinkedBlockingQueue that holds TriggerRequest objects waiting to be acted upon.
      private java.util.ArrayList<TriggerLogicBlock> triggers
      An ArrayList containing all of the TriggerLogicBlock objects in the automation system.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MainController()
      This constructor creates a new MainController and initializes the lists and queue of the MainController class and initializes the NetworkAdapter to be located at "/dev/ttyUSB0" using a bit rate of 9600 bits/sec.

      • services

        private java.util.ArrayList<Service> services
        An ArrayList containing all of the Service objects in the automation system.

      • peripherals

        private java.util.ArrayList<Peripheral> peripherals
        An ArrayList containing all of the Peripheral objects in the automation system.

      • triggers

        private java.util.ArrayList<TriggerLogicBlock> triggers
        An ArrayList containing all of the TriggerLogicBlock objects in the automation system. Because logic blocks are all attached, this list provides access to every LogicBlock object in the system.

      • triggerQueue

        private java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<TriggerRequest> triggerQueue
        A LinkedBlockingQueue that holds TriggerRequest objects waiting to be acted upon.

      • mAdapter

        private NetworkAdapter mAdapter
        A NetworkAdapter that handles all communication with physical peripherals.

        private final java.lang.String databasePassword
        A String containing the database password. A future version of this software should store the database user name and password in an encrypted file.

      • MainController

        public MainController()
        This constructor creates a new MainController and initializes the lists and queue of the MainController class and initializes the NetworkAdapter to be located at "/dev/ttyUSB0" using a bit rate of 9600 bits/sec.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This method creates a MainController object, initializes its peripherals and services, makes it start managing triggers and sessions, and starts the HTTPS server listening on port 443.
        Parameters:
        args - This parameter is never used.

      • addPeripheral

        public java.lang.String addPeripheral(int peripheralType,
                             int peripheralID,
                             java.lang.String name)
        This method adds a new Peripheral to the automation system. The Peripheral object is created, passing this main controller as the trigger handler and mAdapter's network as the network. Then the new Peripheral is added to peripherals.
        Parameters:
        peripheralType - The int type ID of the new Peripheral.
        peripheralID - The int peripheral ID of the new Peripheral.
        name - A String containing the name of the new peripheral.
        Returns:
        A String containing "device_added" or "invalid_name" depending on the situation.

      • initializePeripherals

        public void initializePeripherals()
        This method is used to initialize any known Peripheral objects at startup.

      • initializeServices

        public void initializeServices()
        This method is used to initialize any known Service objects at startup.

      • createNewService

        public java.lang.String createNewService(java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.String serviceRepresentation)
        This method creates a new Service object with the specified service name and representation and adds it to services.
        Parameters:
        name - A String containing the name of the Service to be created.
        serviceRepresentation - AString containing the service representation of the new Service.
        Returns:
        A String containing either "service_created", "invalid_name", or "creation_failed" depending on the situation.
        See Also:
        Service

      • editService

        public java.lang.String editService(java.lang.String serviceName,
                           java.lang.String editedServiceString)
        This method edits a Service so that if this method returns "service_edited", the Service of interest will be representable by the provided service representation.
        Parameters:
        serviceName - A String containing the name of the Service to be edited.
        editedServiceString - A String representation of what the Service should be changed to.
        Returns:
        A String containing either "service_edited", "edit_failed", or "invalid_name" depending on the situation.
        See Also:

      • searchForPeripheral

        public java.lang.String searchForPeripheral(int numSecondsToWait)
        This method asks the mAdapter network to search for a new peripheral and returns the new peripheral information if one was found.
        Parameters:
        numSecondsToWait - An int containing the number of seconds to wait for the peripheral to respond.
        Returns:
        A String containing either "no_signal_detected" or "signal_detected|[device type ID]|[device ID]" depending on the situation.
        See Also:
        NetworkAdapter

      • getServiceInfo

        public java.lang.String getServiceInfo(java.lang.String serviceName)
        This method returns the information of the triggers and actions in a Service in String format. The String begins with the name of the Service and then trigger and action information, where each term is separated by a "|". For a trigger, the format is "t`[device name]`[trigger name]`[arg1]`[arg2]`...". For a trigger, the format is "a`[device name]`[action name]`[arg1]`[arg2]`...".
        Parameters:
        serviceName - A String containing the name of the Service whose information should be returned.
        Returns:
        A String containing the trigger and action information of the Service or "invalid_name", depending on the situation.
        See Also:
        Service

      • getPeripheralInfo

        public java.lang.String getPeripheralInfo(java.lang.String peripheralName)
        This method returns the XML information of a Peripheral.
        Parameters:
        peripheralName - A String containing the name of the Peripheral whose information is requested.
        Returns:
        A String containing either "invalid_name" or the XML information of the Peripheral.
        See Also:
        Peripheral

      • getStatus

        public java.lang.String getStatus(java.lang.String peripheralName,
                         java.lang.String statusName)
        This method returns the requested status String of the specified Peripheral.
        Parameters:
        peripheralName - A String containing the name of the Peripheral whose status is being requested.
        statusName - A String containing the name of the status being requested.
        Returns:
        A String containing the requested status or "invalid_name" or "invalid_status", depending on the situation.
        See Also:
        Peripheral

      • doAction

        public java.lang.String doAction(java.lang.String peripheralName,
                        java.lang.String actionName,
                        java.lang.String... arguments)
        This method calls the doAction method on the specified Peripheral to perform the desired action.
        Parameters:
        peripheralName - A String containing the name of the Peripheral that should perform the action.
        actionName - A String containing the name of the action to be performed.
        arguments - An array of String objects containing the arguments for the action to be performed.
        Returns:
        A String containing "action_complete" or "invalid_action" or "invalid_peripheral_name" depending on the situation.
        See Also:
        Peripheral

      • authenticateUser

        public java.lang.String authenticateUser(java.lang.String userName,
                                java.lang.String password)
        This method authenticates a user by checking the user name and password in the MySQL database and returns a new session ID if the combination is valid or null if it is not.
        Parameters:
        userName - A String containing the user name to be authenticated.
        password - A String containing the password to be authenticated.
        Returns:
        A String containing a new session ID if the combination is valid or null if it is not.

      • editUserName

        public java.lang.String editUserName(java.lang.String oldName,
                            java.lang.String newName)
        This method edits the user name of a user by changing the user name in the MySQL database.
        Parameters:
        oldName - A String containing the old user name.
        newName - A String containing the new user name.
        Returns:
        A String containing either "name_edited" or "edit_failed" depending on the situation.

      • editPassword

        public java.lang.String editPassword(java.lang.String oldPassword,
                            java.lang.String newPassword)
        This method edits the password of a user by changing the password in the MySQL database.
        Parameters:
        oldPassword - A String containing the old password.
        newPassword - A String containing the new password.
        Returns:
        A String containing either "password_edited" or "edit_failed" depending on the situation.

      • getUserAccountExists

        public boolean getUserAccountExists()
        This method checks whether or not a user account exists in the system or not by checking the MySQL database.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating whether or not an account exists.

      • createUserAccount

        public java.lang.String createUserAccount(java.lang.String userName,
                                 java.lang.String password)
        This method creates a user account and adds it to the MySQL database and automatically authenticates the new account.
        Parameters:
        userName - A String containing the user name of the new account.
        password - A String containing the password of the new account.
        Returns:
        A String containing a new session ID if the account was created or null if it is not.

      • validateSID

        public boolean validateSID(java.lang.String sid)
        This method validates a session ID by checking the MySQL database and then updates the session ID expiry time. If the session ID is in the database but has expired, it is deleted.
        Parameters:
        sid - A String containing the session ID to be validated.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating whether or not the session ID is valid.

      • destroySID

        public void destroySID(java.lang.String sid)
        This method removes the specified session ID from the database.
        Parameters:
        sid - A String containing the session ID to be removed.

      • newDescriptorAdded

        public void newDescriptorAdded()
        This method refreshes the peripheral descriptor plugins.
        See Also:
        DescriptorFactory

      • manageTriggers

        private void manageTriggers()
        This method creates and starts a new Thread that takes trigger requests off of the triggerQueue and updates the appropriate trigger.

      • triggerOccurred

        public void triggerOccurred(boolean value,
                   Peripheral peripheral,
                   java.lang.String triggerName,
                   java.lang.String... arguments)
        This method is called to notify the main controller of a trigger occurrence. The trigger request is placed on the triggerQueue to be handled by the trigger manager thread.
        Specified by:
        triggerOccurred in interface TriggerHandler
        Parameters:
        value - A boolean containing the value of the trigger.
        peripheral - The Peripheral on which the trigger occurred.
        triggerName - A String containing the name of the trigger that occurred.
        arguments - A String array containing the arguments of the trigger that occurred.

      • updateTrigger

        private void updateTrigger(boolean value,
                 Peripheral peripheral,
                 java.lang.String triggerName,
                 java.lang.String... arguments)
        This method updates the output value of a trigger, which is represented by a TriggerLogicBlock.
        Parameters:
        value - A boolean containing the new trigger output.
        peripheral - The Peripheral on which the trigger occurred.
        triggerName - A String containing the name of the trigger that occurred.
        arguments - A String array containing the arguments of the trigger that occurred.
        See Also:
        TriggerLogicBlock

      • manageSessions

        private void manageSessions()
        This method creates and starts a new Thread that checks the database for expired session IDs every hour. Any expired IDs are removed from the database.

      • toHex

        private static java.lang.String toHex(byte[] bytes)
        This method converts an array of bytes into a String of hexadecimal characters.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The array of bytes to be converted.
        Returns:
        A String of hexadecimal numbers representing the array of bytes.
